intro: Cacalia amagiensis, commonly known as the Amami bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Amami Islands of Japan. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Cacalia amagiensis is considered a rare and endemic species, highlighting its ecological significance in its native habitat.
